alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; Laramie Valley; Shirley Basin; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued January 11 at 1:49PM MST until January 12 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM TO 5 PM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...West winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 70 mph expected. Areas of blowing snow reducing visibility under a half mile Friday afternoon. * WHERE...Ferris/Seminoe/Shirley Mountains, Shirley Basin, Laramie Valley, South Laramie Range, South Laramie Range Foothills and Central Laramie County. * WHEN...From 5 AM to 5 PM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Mainly to transportation. Strong cross winds will be hazardous to light weight or high profile vehicles, including campers and tractor trailers. Areas of blowing snow may result in localized areas of significantly reduced visibilities at times, along with slick road conditions.
info.instruction: People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use caution if you must drive.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; Laramie Valley; Shirley Basin; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills
